etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek drosos ‘dew, moisture’ + philos ‘loving’

definitions: a small fruit fly, used extensively in genetic research because of its large chromosomes, numerous varieties, and rapid rate of reproduction.

notes.text: Genus Drosophila, family Drosophilidae: in particular D. melanogaster

shortDefinitions: small fruit fly, used extensively in genetic research because of its large chromosomes
